intro: Cistanthe lamprosperma, commonly known as the silverleaf cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Cistanthe lamprosperma is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
